page.title: 07AN EDGMOND FARM WORKER
page.content: {Oswald Powell}came from North Wales and moved to Edgmond because he needed work. At first he lived in one of 6 council houses in the area used by farm workers. He now lives in a tied house belonging to his employer. 40 years ago he looked after 800 sheep but now he works machinery. Employment on the farm has dropped three-quarters but Ozzy thinks it is much better as the jobs are done more efficiently and quickly. He thinks{recreation}in Edgmond is good, there are lots of {clubs}and many activities for all ages. He often goes to the pub to meet his friends. His wife enjoys shopping in Newport every day to meet her friends. Ozzy thinks that Edgmond has changed for the better as it has ample facilities and is in easy reach of larger towns but is still a pleasant quiet place to live.
